Topic.Title: Why Google makes no profit with 70% Android market share?

Message.Msg: Android users don't buy online, advertisers don't spend on advertisement. Google makes no money. Simple formula.

Message.Title: Any thoughts on GOOG buying GRPN, I think major mistake
Message.Msg: Grpn is in the toilet, books are cooked, SEC isn't done with them yet, no real Management and Directors and large shareholders of dubious character. Why on Earth would GOOG want this pig, even for free. Comments PLEASE!! Thank You. ( I have no position in GOOG at the moment)

Topic.Title: Any thoughts on GOOG buying GRPN, I think major mistake

Message.Msg: Google isn't buying Groupon silly, Groupon is making an offer for Living Social. LOL And, nice on the full disclosure. Convenient of you not to mention your short GRPN! LOL And for the record, everyone on over at the GRPN board took a poll on whether we miss you or not. But to find out the results, you'll have to head back over and show yourself, something you haven't done much of since the price moved against'ya.

Message.Title: Targeting is the MAGIC WORD of Mobile Search
Message.Msg: and Local Corp is the clear leader in this direction.

Topic.Title: Targeting is the MAGIC WORD of Mobile Search

Message.Msg: First step of targeting of Local Corp: Concentration on Local Search Led by mobile search, local digital advertising is likely to grow over 13 percent in 2012 and will soon make up 25 percent or more of the local ad market. The forecast, completed by BIA/Kelsey, pegs mobile search growth at an astounding 77.2 percent, followed by online video at 51.6 percent and social media growth at 26.3 percent.

Message.Title: Google makes zero profit in China!
Message.Msg: “In China, cheaper Android devices have exploded past Apple’s phones in the last three years, and now account for more than three-quarters of shipments,” Leber reports. “But what’s often overlooked is how little Google itself is benefiting from Android’s growth in China. Most Android devices sold in China have been stripped of Google’s advertising-supported apps and services, as well as its Google Play store for third-party apps and music, books, and video. That means the devices are missing the two main ways by which the U.S. Web giant brings in revenue from the free Android operating system. The CEO of Baidu, the desktop Web search leader in China, said this year that 80 percent of Android-branded phones come with Baidu’s search service, rather than Google’s, loaded on the device… [Google] significantly scale[d] back its operations in 2010 when it took its search business out of the country in a stand against the Chinese government’s censorship.”

Topic.Title: Why Google makes no profit with 70% Android market share?

Message.Msg: Zero profit from Android in China. Looks like free OS is good for everyone else. Good luck wasting your resources to support everyone else's profits. Greta business model!
